There is only one legal way to do this without any copyright issues: get permission from the owner of the video. Copyright law doesn’t allow the redistribution of someone else’s work. And YouTube is very diligent about scanning uploads, seeking duplicates.

No. This would be copyright infringement, a crime at the international level. Crediting your sources will not protect you from being struck for copyright, and downloading videos you don’t own from YouTube with the intent to repost them is a Terms of Service violation.
